question: How do I register for a first dose vaccination? How to use the website 1922.gov.tw to apply to get vaccinated for my 1st jab of AZ or Moderna?
answer: Everyone older than 18 can now begin registration. At the time of writing 7/13 around noon the official website was overloaded so it took me 1 hour to get to the 2nd page. Here are some tips and guidance:  Have everything ready before you begin the process Google Translate doesn't work on all the buttons and some reported using the plugin stopped the process.   Page 1: Browse to https://1922.gov.tw/vas and keep refreshing (F5) until you see the blue box for registration and can click the button [Register] 登記 (1) to go to page 2. Page 2: National Health Insurance Card: You need both your ARC/APRC number (1) and the NHI number (2) and enter the confirmation number (3) then click to continue (4). Page 3: Check the info and select your county and district(1) (picture shows example for Taichung + West District), choose preferred vaccine type (2) (picture shows example for both AZ and Moderna) and accept terms and conditions (3) then click to continue (4). Page 4: Congratulations, if you see this page your registration was successful.  Please note that this is only a registration of your willingness to get vaccinated. Now you have to wait for a text (SMS) message with further instructions in the coming days or weeks.
formatAnswer: Everyone older than 18 can begin registration between 7/13 12:00 and 7/15 17:00. Check or download our [step-by-step guide](https://www.covid-taichung.com/vaccination-guide/) or read on for basic instructions:: - Once you get to page 2 you have 10 minutes to complete the process so have your National Health Insurance card and Chinese address ready before you begin - Translation services don't work on all the buttons and some reported that the software or plugin stopped or restarted the process - Page 1: Browse to [https://1922.gov.tw/vas](https://1922.gov.tw/vas) and can click the button [Register] 登記 in the blue box. - Page 2: Enter the ARC/APRC and NHI number that are on your NHI card. Then enter the confirmation code and click the button at the bottom. - Page 3: Check your info and add your phone (only numbers 09XXXXXXX). Then select your county and district, select preferred vaccine type(s), and accept terms and conditions. -Page 4: This page confirms your date and time of registration and shows a registration ID. We recommend to take a screenshot then you can close the page. This is only a registration of your willingness to get vaccinated. Now you have to wait for a text (SMS) message from 1922 with further instructions in the coming days.
formatQuestion: ### How do I register for a first dose vaccination? How to use the website 1922.gov.tw to apply to get vaccinated for my 1st jab of AZ or Moderna?

question: What epidemic alert level is Taiwan in currently? What are the guidelines and rules for Taichung at this moment? What's the COVID-level 3 timeline or end date?
answer: 7/11 Taichung city government has decided which restrictions will be loosened. Most remain the same but some tourist spots will reopen in Taichung from 7/13. Note that platforms, physical fitness facilities, children's recreational facilities, and pavilions remain closed:  Dakeng hiking trails No. 1 to 8, Tanzi Xintian trail, Dadu hiking trails, Wuri Zhi Gao Zhun walking trail, Cheng Gong trails, Rainbow Village Hongfeng Bicycle Green Way, Hou-Fong bike path, Tanya Shen Green Bikeway Dajia Tiezhenshan Scenic Area Walkways at the Daan Mazu Gaomei Coastal area (beaches remain closed) Tourist sites that remain closed in Taichung until 7/26:  Dakeng hiking trails No. 9 to 10 and Guguan Hot Spring Travel Service Centers at public transport stations, airports and tourist sites 7/8 CDC has extended alert level 3 to July 26, 2021. Local governments may loosen some restrictions starting 7/13.  6/24 CDC has extended the Nationwide Level 3 epidemic alert 3 to July 12, 2021.  6/10 CDC listed regulations and guidelines in English. A quick summary:  Obligated/Fined: Always wear masks outdoors. Those with symptoms should seek medical attention. Supermarkets, stores, and businesses must implement crowd control measures.  Closed/Banned: All parks, night markets, playgrounds, schools & daycare, community services & workshops, sports venues, libraries, tourist sites, leisure & entertainment venues, weddings & memorials, places of worship are closed. No more than 9 people (including you) may gather outdoors, and no more than 4 people (including you) indoors, those living together not included. As soon as you have 1 visitor in your family home who has a different official address, the rule of maximum 4 applies.   Advised: Social distancing, reduce shopping frequency, distance working, flexible hours, avoid all non-essential travel to all countries.  Others: Food & beverage vendors only takeout. Enhanced disinfection of public places and public transport, details on our maps page.
formatAnswer:
7/11 Taichung city government has decided which restrictions will be loosened. Most remain the same but **[some tourist spots](https://www.covid-taichung.com/frequently-asked-questions/#)** will reopen in Taichung from 7/13 (but platforms, physical fitness facilities, children's recreational facilities, and pavilions remain closed):
- Dakeng hiking trails No. 1 to 8, Tanzi Xintian trail, Dadu hiking trails, Wuri Zhi Gao Zhun walking trail, Cheng Gong trails, Rainbow Village
- Hongfeng Bicycle Green Way, Hou-Fong bike path, Tanya Shen Green Bikeway
- Dajia Tiezhenshan Scenic Area
- Walkways at the Daan Mazu Gaomei Coastal area (beaches remain closed)

Tourist sites that **remain closed in Taichung until 7/26**:
- Dakeng hiking trails No. 9 to 10 and Guguan Hot Spring
- Travel Service Centers at public transport stations, airports and tourist sites

**7/8** CDC has [extended alert level 3 to July 26, 2021](https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Bulletin/Detail/vlmAORqyqEntz1Tr_Ls7DQ?typeid=158). Local governments may loosen some restrictions starting 7/13.

6/24 CDC has extended the [Nationwide Level 3 epidemic alert 3 to July 12, 2021](https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Bulletin/Detail/en36fygNXciYYgmgcWPHuQ?typeid=158).

6/10 CDC listed [regulations and guidelines in English](https://www.cdc.gov.tw/En/Bulletin/Detail/uIsfZpLbzqQ_uBK71xZ8Xg?typeid=158). A quick summary:

**Obligated/Fined**: Always wear masks outdoors. Those with symptoms should seek medical attention. Supermarkets, stores, and businesses must implement crowd control measures.

**Closed/Banned**: All parks, night markets, playgrounds, schools & daycare, community services & workshops, sports venues, libraries, tourist sites, leisure & entertainment venues, weddings & memorials, places of worship are closed. No more than 9 people (including you) may gather outdoors, and no more than 4 people (including you) indoors, those living together not included. As soon as you have 1 visitor in your family home who has a different official address, the rule of maximum 4 applies. 

**Advised**: Social distancing, reduce shopping frequency, distance working, flexible hours, avoid all non-essential travel to all countries.

**Others**: Food & beverage vendors only takeout. [Enhanced disinfection of public places and public transport, details on our maps page](https://www.covid-taichung.com/maps/).

question: When can I get a vaccine in Taiwan? Am I eligible? What are the priorities for vaccination? How can I register for my first dose of Moderna or Astra Zeneca?
answer: Vaccination locations and information change almost daily. We've added the main health facilities in Taichung that provide English services to our covid map and update as we go.   7/8 It has been confirmed that anyone in Taiwan aged 18-64 with medical conditions (details below) as well as anyone older than 50 can now make a reservation here. You will be put on a waiting list and receive a text (SMS) message with further instructions in the coming weeks.  Click the button [Register] (登記) at the bottom of the blue section. On the next page enter both numbers on your NHCI (National Health Insurance Card).  Type the verification code and click the button [Verification] (執行身分認證). If you have a new ARC number (BXXXXXXXXX) and you receive an error, try again with your old number (BCXXXXXXXX) or vice versa. If you are in a priority group because of your job, your employer will inform you. This summary applies to individuals and is updated regularly based on feedback from Taichung health centers:  Those required to travel abroad under special circumstances  All people older than 50 years (50-69 on waitlist, +70 has priority) Pregnant women (talk to your physician as there are special clinics available) Adults ages 18-49 with high-risk diseases, rare diseases, or serious medical conditions (talk to your physician) 6/2 the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) first listed 10 priority groups.
formatAnswer:
Vaccination locations and information change almost daily. We've added the main health facilities in Taichung that provide English services to [our covid map](https://www.covid-taichung.com/maps/) and update as we go. 

**7/13** Anyone older than 18 can now register their "willingness to get vaccinated". We wrote a [separate FAQ about this with detailed instructions](https://www.covid-taichung.com/frequently-asked-questions/#question26).

**7/11** For those in groups 9 and 10 that have registered, [text messages will be sent out from 7/13](https://www.cdc.gov.tw/Bulletin/Detail/LFEwMGAQQaE-q0wQ6ioHkQ?typeid=9) and vaccinations will start 7/16. CDC adds that the next 3 weeks will be Astra Zeneca.

**7/8** It has been confirmed that anyone in Taiwan aged 18-64 with medical conditions (details below) as well as anyone older than 50 can [make a reservation](https://1922.gov.tw/vas/) here (closed on 7/12 17:00). You will be put on a waiting list and receive a text (SMS) message with further instructions in the coming weeks.
- Click the button [Register] (登記) at the bottom of the blue section. On the next page enter both numbers on your NHIC (National Health Insurance Card). 
- Type the verification code and click the button [Verification] (執行身分認證). If you have a new ARC number (BXXXXXXXXX) and you receive an error, try again with your old number (BCXXXXXXXX) or vice versa.

If you are in a priority group because of your job, your employer will inform you. This summary applies to individuals that can book vaccination now and is updated regularly based on feedback from Taichung health centers:
- Those required to travel abroad under special circumstances 
- All people older than 50 years (50-69 on waitlist, +70 has priority)
- Pregnant women (talk to your physician)
- Adults ages 18-64 with [high-risk diseases](https://reurl.cc/Nr2E36), [rare diseases](https://reurl.cc/R02Qx6), or serious medical conditions (talk to your physician)

**6/2** the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) first listed [10 priority groups](https://www.taiwannews.com.tw/en/news/4214853).

question: Where can I get a Covid self-test kit? How to use the coronavirus testing kit at home?
answer: 7/11 CDC posted a YouTube video with English audio and subtitles: Instructions for the use of COVID 19 home test kits  COVID-19 rapid antigen self-test kits can be purchased at drug stores, pharmacies, medical equipment shops, and convenience stores.  Check for FDA-approved tests (click links that end with Chinese date eg 110.7.1). Follow the instructions to collect a sample and administer the test. When the result is negative, place the kit in a sealed plastic bag and dispose in the household garbage. When the result is positive, immediately call the toll-free hotline 1922 and go into home quarantine (separate rooms including bathroom, always mask). If you're unable to go into home isolation, put the test kit in sealed plastic bag, visit a nearby clinic or hospital asap and hand it to the staff, wear a mask at all times, and do not use public transport
formatAnswer:
**7/11** CDC posted a YouTube video with English audio and subtitles: [Instructions for the use of COVID 19 home test kits](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D5QIkMmy5fw)
- COVID-19 rapid antigen self-test kits can be purchased at drug stores, pharmacies, medical equipment shops, and convenience stores. 
- [Check for FDA-approved tests](https://www.fda.gov.tw/tc/site.aspx?sid=11740&r=2001764921) (click links that end with Chinese date eg 110.7.1).
- Follow the instructions to collect a sample and administer the test.
- When the **result is negative**, place the kit in a sealed plastic bag and dispose in the household garbage.
- When the **result is positive**, immediately call the toll-free hotline 1922 and go into home quarantine (separate rooms including bathroom, always mask). If you're unable to go into home isolation, put the test kit in sealed plastic bag, visit a nearby clinic or hospital asap and hand it to the staff, wear a mask at all times, and do not use public transport

question: Can I get a loan or subsidy for my job, company, or family? Do COVID-19 relief or bailout programs apply to foreigners in Taiwan?
answer: 7/8 If you have Taiwanese citizenship, an APRC or Taiwanese spouse, you are most likely eligible for the relief programs for individuals and families. APRC holders that fit the requirements can receive 27K NTD, citizenship or spouse 30K, and/or 10K per child. Check the table with more info and links for application.  If you're a business owner, there are many different programs and requirements and most of the information is in Chinese. So we recommend to check with your accountant or a Taiwanese employee or friend.  The Taiwanese government has created this website to explain all the options and rules for relief program 4.0  You can choose English at the top left for auto-translation. Eligibility depends on your situation so do your own research. But when you live and pay taxes in Taiwan, or own a company that does, some programs should apply. If you can't work it out, call the CDC service line at 1988 and ask for relief package assistance in English. There may be a queue so please prepare before you call.
formatAnswer:
**7/8** If you have **Taiwanese citizenship, an APRC or Taiwanese spouse**, you may be eligible for the relief programs for individuals and families. APRC holders that fit the requirements can receive 27K NTD, citizenship or spouse 30K, and/or 10K per child. [Check the table with more info and links for application](https://www.gov.tw/News_Content.aspx?n=37&s=545340&sms=9100#active2).

If you're a business owner, there are many different programs and requirements and most of the information is in Chinese. So we recommend to check with your accountant or a Taiwanese employee or friend.

The Taiwanese government has created this [website to explain all the options and rules for relief program 4.0](https://www.gov.tw/News_Content.aspx?n=37&s=545340&sms=9100)
- You can choose English at the top left for auto-translation.
- Eligibility depends on your situation so do your own research. But when you live and pay taxes in Taiwan, or own a company that does, some programs should apply.
- If you can't work it out, call the CDC service line at 1988 and ask for relief package assistance in English. There may be a queue so please prepare before you call.

question: I'm worried I've got COVID. Is there a covid screening station in Taichung where I can get a free COVID-19 test?
answer: 6/25 UPDATE several health facilities have set up outdoors COVID-19 Fast Screening Stations to provide rapid antigen testing for free if you have an official address in Taichung.  Bring ID cards (ARC, APRC, VISA), health insurance cards (NHIC), and wear medical masks throughout the journey. Most locations require you to make an online appointment and ask to come early. Check our map for more details and help with navigation. Screening services will be suspended if they run out of tests If the test result is negative, you will be notified on the spot, and no paper report will be provided (result can be checked in your health passbook 1-3 days after) Those who test positive will be transferred to the emergency room for follow-up
formatAnswer:
**6/25** several **health facilities have set up outdoors COVID-19 Fast Screening Stations** to provide rapid antigen testing for free if you have an official address in Taichung.
- Bring ID cards (ARC, APRC, VISA), health insurance cards (NHIC), and wear medical masks throughout the journey.
- Most locations require you to make an online appointment and ask to come early. Check [our map](https://www.covid-taichung.com/maps/) for more details and help with navigation.
- Screening services will be suspended if they run out of tests
- If the test result is negative, you will be notified on the spot, and no paper report will be provided (result can be checked in your health passbook 1-3 days after)
- Those who test positive will be transferred to the emergency room for follow-up
